cheatsheet.title: Create a new connection overview analysis

intro.description: This kind of analysis gives you an overview of the content of a database. It computes the number of tables and the number of rows per table for each catalog or schema and also counts the number of indexes and primary keys.

item.title: Set the analysis metadata.
item.description: To open the Create New Analysis wizard, right click Analyses on the DQ Repository view and select New Analysis. Then expand Structural Analysis and select Connection Overview Analysis. The wizard prompts you to provide the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description...). Select the connection of interest from the list and then set filters on the tables or views if required. Upon completion, an editor opens in which you can modify the analysis metadata and define the analysis settings.

item.title: Review your settings
item.description: If required, click Analysis Parameters on the Connection Overview Analysis editor to check or modify filters the table or view filters.

item.title: Analyze.
item.description: Click the Run icon, located towards the top left of the editor, to execute the analysis. Alternatively, right click the analysis on the DQ Repository tree view and click the Run icon on the list which appears.
